requirement_tested: Create new to-do items with title and description
user_persona: A busy professional who needs to quickly jot down tasks.
user_goal: To add a new task titled 'Prepare presentation' with a description 'Slides for Q4 review meeting'.

narrative_steps.title: Entering Task Details
narrative_steps.description: Sarah opens the app and sees the form at the top. She fills in the title and description fields.
narrative_steps.action: Enter 'Prepare presentation' into the title input and 'Slides for Q4 review meeting' into the description textarea.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both input fields accept the text, and the submit button becomes enabled.

narrative_steps.title: Submitting New Task
narrative_steps.description: Satisfied with her entries, Sarah presses Enter to submit the task quickly.
narrative_steps.action: Press Enter while focused on the title input field.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The task is saved to the database, appears at the top of the list, and the input fields are cleared.

requirement_tested: Edit existing to-do items including title and description
user_persona: A project manager reviewing task details.
user_goal: To correct a typo in an existing task's title and update its description.

narrative_steps.title: Initiating Edit Mode
narrative_steps.description: Alex notices a typo in a task titled 'Prepeare report'. He clicks the edit icon next to it.
narrative_steps.action: Click the edit icon [editTaskIcon] for the task.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The task switches to inline-edit mode with pre-filled inputs showing current title and description.

narrative_steps.title: Updating Task Information
narrative_steps.description: Alex corrects the title to 'Prepare report' and adds more detail to the description.
narrative_steps.action: Modify the title input to 'Prepare report' and update the description textarea.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Input fields accept the updated values without error.

narrative_steps.title: Saving Changes
narrative_steps.description: After making corrections, Alex clicks the save button to confirm changes.
narrative_steps.action: Click the save button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The task updates in the database and reverts to display mode showing the corrected information.

user_persona: A user cleaning up outdated tasks.
user_goal: To remove an obsolete task titled 'Draft proposal v1'.

narrative_steps.title: Locating Obsolete Task
narrative_steps.description: Jamie scrolls through the list and finds the task 'Draft proposal v1' which is no longer needed.
narrative_steps.action: Scroll to locate the task 'Draft proposal v1'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The task is visible in the list view.

narrative_steps.title: Deleting the Task
narrative_steps.description: Jamie clicks the delete icon at the end of the task row to remove it permanently.
narrative_steps.action: Click the delete icon [deleteTaskIcon] for the task.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The task disappears immediately from the list and is removed from the database.

user_goal: To mark a homework task as completed after finishing it.

narrative_steps.title: Finding Incomplete Task
narrative_steps.description: Taylor locates the task 'Complete math exercises' in the pending list.
narrative_steps.action: Locate the task 'Complete math exercises'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The task is displayed normally without strikethrough styling.

narrative_steps.title: Marking as Complete
narrative_steps.description: Taylor clicks the checkbox next to the task to indicate completion.
narrative_steps.action: Click the checkbox for the task.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The task now shows strikethrough text and reduced opacity, reflecting its completed status.

user_persona: A team lead checking project progress.
user_goal: To view only completed tasks to assess what has been finished this week.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Filter Controls
narrative_steps.description: Jordan looks at the top of the task list and sees the filter options.
narrative_steps.action: View the filter buttons ('All', 'Completed', 'Pending').
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All three filter buttons are clearly visible above the task list.

narrative_steps.title: Applying Completed Filter
narrative_steps.description: Jordan clicks the 'Completed' button to focus on finished work.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Completed' filter button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Only tasks marked as completed are shown in the list, with the 'Completed' button appearing selected.

requirement_tested: Search to-do items by keywords in title or description
user_persona: A researcher looking for a specific note.
user_goal: To find tasks containing the word 'research' in either title or description.

narrative_steps.title: Using Search Bar
narrative_steps.description: Casey remembers writing something about 'market research' and uses the search bar.
narrative_steps.action: Type 'research' into the search input field labeled 'Search Tasks'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The task list dynamically filters to show only tasks matching the keyword in title or description.

requirement_tested: Browse all to-do items in a list view
user_persona: A new user getting familiar with the app.
user_goal: To see all available tasks in one place.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Full Task List
narrative_steps.description: Morgan opens the app and expects to see all tasks listed neatly.
narrative_steps.action: Load the main page and observe the task list container.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A vertically scrollable list displays all tasks with consistent styling and spacing.

requirement_tested: Display to-do items with clear visual distinction between completed and pending tasks
user_persona: A visual learner preferring clear status indicators.
user_goal: To quickly identify which tasks are done versus still pending.

narrative_steps.title: Observing Task Styles
narrative_steps.description: Riley scans the list and looks for visual cues to distinguish task statuses.
narrative_steps.action: Scan the task list for visual differences.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Completed tasks have strikethrough text and reduced opacity; pending tasks appear in normal styling.

requirement_tested: Provide a text input field for entering new task titles
user_persona: A frequent task creator who likes speed.
user_goal: To quickly type a new task title and move forward.

narrative_steps.title: Typing Task Title
narrative_steps.description: Pat starts typing a new task idea directly into the designated title input field.
narrative_steps.action: Enter 'Call client' into the 'New Task Title' input field.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The input field accepts the text and enables submission mechanisms.

requirement_tested: Include a text area for detailed task descriptions
user_persona: Someone needing to capture extensive notes per task.
user_goal: To write detailed instructions in the task description area.

narrative_steps.title: Adding Detailed Notes
narrative_steps.description: Dana wants to elaborate on how to approach a complex task.
narrative_steps.action: Type multiple lines of explanation into the 'Task Description' text area.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The text area accommodates multiline input and preserves formatting like line breaks.

requirement_tested: Show a checkbox component for marking tasks as completed
user_persona: A checklist-oriented person managing daily routines.
user_goal: To check off completed routine activities efficiently.

narrative_steps.title: Interacting with Checkbox
narrative_steps.description: Kai prefers clicking checkboxes rather than buttons to mark things done.
narrative_steps.action: Click the checkbox beside a pending task.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The checkbox fills with a checkmark and the task visually updates to reflect completion.

requirement_tested: Implement delete button/icon for each to-do item
user_persona: A minimalist keeping their list clutter-free.
user_goal: To instantly remove irrelevant tasks using the delete icon.

narrative_steps.title: Removing Unwanted Task
narrative_steps.description: Bo no longer needs a reminder and decides to delete it immediately.
narrative_steps.action: Click the trash bin icon [deleteTaskIcon] at the end of a task row.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The task vanishes from the list and backend storage instantly.

requirement_tested: Add filter controls for viewing all/completed/pending tasks
user_persona: A productivity enthusiast organizing tasks by status.
user_goal: To switch between different filtered views easily.

narrative_steps.title: Switching Filters
narrative_steps.description: Quinn wants to first see pending tasks, then switch to completed ones.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Pending' filter button, then click the 'Completed' filter button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The task list updates to show only pending tasks, then switches to show only completed tasks.

requirement_tested: Include a search input field for finding specific tasks
user_goal: To locate a particular task amidst dozens using keywords.

narrative_steps.title: Searching Through Many Tasks
narrative_steps.description: Ash has too many tasks and needs to find one about 'budget approval'.
narrative_steps.action: Type 'budget approval' into the prominent search field labeled 'Find Tasks...'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The list narrows down in real time to show only matching tasks.

requirement_tested: Apply lavender background color and indigo component styling throughout all pages
user_persona: A design-conscious user valuing consistent aesthetics.
user_goal: To experience uniform visual styling across the entire application.

narrative_steps.title: Noticing Consistent Styling
narrative_steps.description: Cam appreciates apps with cohesive themes and checks if everything matches.
narrative_steps.action: Observe overall page background and component colors.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The entire viewport has a lavender background, and all interactive components use indigo styling consistently.
